titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Pharmacy Technician - Description

body.p: As of 1 July 2011, a Pharmacy Technician is a CARE PROFESSIONAL who is registered with the General Pharmaceutical Council ( GPhC ).
A Pharmacy Technician works under the direct supervision of a Pharmacist and carries out duties such as preparing and dispensing PRESCRIPTIONS and other health care products to PATIENTS .
In order for Pharmacy Technicians to practise in Great Britain, from 1 July 2011, they must be registered with the General Pharmaceutical Council and must renew their registration annually.

Once a Pharmacy Technician registers with the General Pharmaceutical Council , they are allocated a registration number which uniquely identifies each registered Pharmacy Technician . This registration number is a 7 digit number starting with the number 5.
All Pharmacy Technicians who are currently licensed to practise in Great Britain are listed on the General Pharmaceutical Council Register .
